basic.floral_language:
Euphorbia milii
Floriography: unbending, faithful, loyal
Native to Madagascar, Euphorbia milii is a fleshy plant. Stems in grayish brown color covered with hard and sharp thorns. Green leaves on the top of stem, obovate. Flowers have 2 petals in opposite direction like small butterflies. Euphorbia milii's sap is slightly toxic, should not touch it if grown at home.
Euphorbia milii likes sunshine, but should take proper shade under summer high temperatures. Flowering in October to February for 3-4 weeks.
basic.blooming: Flowering period October-February, viewing period 3-4 weeks

maintenance.soil: Peat or soil with specific nutrients
maintenance.sunlight: Likes adequate light, in summer use half shade for better care
maintenance.watering: Resistant to drought, water thoroughly when soil is dry
maintenance.fertilization: Fertilization not much required, dilute fertilizers following instructions, apply fertilizers once in each month in spring
maintenance.pruning: Remove old, diseased and dead leaves timely
